clinical_study.brief_title: Suture Contamination Rate in Adjustable Suture Strabismus Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Suture Contamination Rate in Adjustable Suture Strabismus Surgery

brief_summary.textblock:
1. To establish the culture positivity rate in adjustable suture strabismus surgery
2. To identify bacterial species and antibiotic susceptibility patterns of microorganisms cultured from suture material
3. To compare suture contamination rates with techniques to reduce the suture contamination rate

primary_outcome.measure: culture positivity rate in adjustable suture strabismus surgery
primary_outcome.description: 1 cm section of the suture proximal to the knot will be harvested and placed in a tube with 2 ml of trypticase soy broth (TSB).The TSB tubes will be monitored for growth of bacteria at 48 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: post-operative 5%povidone iodine to reduce contamination rate (compare suture contamination rates with techniques)
secondary_outcome.description: To compare suture contamination rates with techniques to reduce the suture contamination rate

secondary_outcome.measure: To identify bacterial species and antibiotic susceptibility patterns of microorganisms cultured from suture material

arm_group.arm_group_label: postoperative 5%povidone iodine eye drop with ointment

intervention.description: At the conclusion of the surgery, all patients will receive a strip of ophthalmic ointment containing antibiotics and corticosteroids into the conjunctival fornix. The subjects will then be randomized (use computer program to generate random digit) into two groups: Group 1: Patients will receive one drop of 5% povidone iodine instilled into the conjunctival fornix. Group 2: Patients will not receive 5% povidone iodine into conjunctival fornix.
intervention.arm_group_label: postoperative 5%povidone iodine eye drop with ointment
